title: How to Make a Nakamura Lock Paper Airplane

steps.headline: Fold a piece of paper in half and crease it.
steps.description: Open it back up (hot dog style).

steps.headline: Fold the top 2 corners down so that there's a triangle above.
Fold the triangle to the bottom.
Fold the top corners down to a point in the middle of the  triangle and fold the bottom of the triangle over the corners that were folded down.
Fold it in half.
steps.description: If you fold it in half the right way, you should see a triangle in the middle on both sides.

steps.headline: Fold  the top edge to the bottom edge on one side.
steps.description: Do the same on the other side. It'll be one of the best airplanes you've ever made.

steps.headline: To fly it, give it a super light push.
steps.description: If you push too hard, it won't fly but you and the plane will stay AWESOME!

text: Fold a piece of paper in half and crease it. Open it back up (hot dog style). Fold the top 2 corners down so that there's a triangle above.  Fold the triangle to the bottom.  Fold the top corners down to a point in the middle of the  triangle and fold the bottom of the triangle over the corners that were folded down.  Fold it in half. If you fold it in half the right way, you should see a triangle in the middle on both sides. Fold  the top edge to the bottom edge on one side. Do the same on the other side. It'll be one of the best airplanes you've ever made. To fly it, give it a super light push. If you push too hard, it won't fly but you and the plane will stay AWESOME!
